Sky Knight turned to see Blazer. Techy took a step forward and went 
to follow Beserk at a safe distance. Sky Knight took a step back to 
Blazer's side.

"Coming around nicely," he said. "He's almost normal. But still, 
things aren't all certain. We still don't know how he would react to 
the public. Anyone he came in contact, he could try to kill." He 
crossed his arms. "I want to take him out, but I think I'm just 
jumping ahead. Beserk has a great curiosity. I like that. He's a fast 
learner." He turned his face to Blazer. "What do you think we should 
do next? He trusts us like he's apart of our team." He lowered his 
head thinking, then his crimson optics brightened. "I got! Well, it 
could be risky, and if something happens we would have to report it. 
I want to see him fight. I want to see if his skills still remain 
after that operation."




Slider sat on the couch of her and Eerie's barracks. They were 
roommates. Slider was a young Predacon, a fighter pilot. She had a 
gray coloring and a slim face. Errie was from a line of unknowns. She 
had an accent and a wildside.

She sat watching the Cybertronian news on a monitor set up on the 
wall, while Eerie walked towards the sleeping area. She had returned 
home with some damage and hungry. She had gone into two big busts in 
one day with her bounty hunting team. She wanted to take a short nap 
to restore her energies.

But before she got to her sleeping area, she heard the name Beserk. 
And so did Shadow. Eerie spun around with her optics wide.

"What?" she snapped.

Slider stood up. "Eerie." Eerie stepped to the metal couch's edge. 
They both listened to the announcement:

"The team were happy to announce that the clone has made an excellent 
recovery, and will be planned to be used against the Maximals. As far 
as is know about his original creators, they will be executed for 
conspiracy, murder, and use of a deadly weapon. Beserk on the other 
hand was given another chance..."

"No!" Eerie shouted. "They can't do that! Ah killed that slaggin' 
thing! Those sons of maintenance bots! They didn't even tell me! They 
can't get away wit' that! Ah'll kill them!" She clentched her fists 
until they shook. "So mah scanner wasn't goin' haywire. Beserk is 
alive. Ah'll teach them bots uh thing or two!"

"Hold up Eerie," Slider said and grabbed her arm before she took 
off. "I know you. You're jus' going to take off and track him down 
again. You're get yourself kill. Maybe even arrested. Beserk might as 
well be under secturity."

"He might break that security t' get t' me."

Slider pulled on her. "Wait. Maybe we should ask Shadow."

"She doesn't know anything! We jus' found out! Ah'm goin' t' find out 
who th' slag is behind this."

"They won't tell you anything," Slider said. "I bet they see you as a 
threat. I bet they know you want him dead and your going to bitch 
about it."

Eerie looked at her and narrowed her crimson optics.
